Academic_Probation_Policy_key3: If a student does end up on academic probation, don't panic. Being placed on academic probation is usually not the same as being asked to leave campus. Students are given a probationary period to demonstrate that they can indeed make successful academic progress.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key4: Academic probation is to indicate that a student is not making progress Navgurukul required for completion of the software development course. It also means that a student’s grades and/or overall performance are not high enough to continue on campus if they do not improve.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key6: Every student who is joining Navgurukul will be in the probation period for the first two months. A student is further placed on Academic Probation based on the following criteria.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key7:
Based on the review of Coaches and Academic Associate, if it is found that a student is not serious about their academics
  - And is not cleear with their previous concepts
  - Making unnecessary excuses to avoid coding continuously for 15 days,
  - Not giving 7 hours at least for coding in a day.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key8:
If a student is failing to maintain 70% of their engagement in academic activities such as
  - Conducting Stand up,
  - Participating in Academic circles,
  - Involving in Pair-Peer Learning
  - Taking classes
  - Conducting and participating in interviews,
  - Mentoring students
  - Attending volunteer run sessions
Academic_Probation_Policy_key9: If the student receives three red flags continuously in weekly assessment tests.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key10: How can you clear the Academic Probation?
Academic_Probation_Policy_key11:
The student should be given a personal mentor and an advisor in resolving academic probation
  - They will take the assistance of their assigned mentors daily in solving their problems in learning.
  - Once in a week T&Ps will interview probationary students.
  - Assigned mentors will give updates to Academic associates on alternate days. Students should make extra efforts and give extra time to studies, a change in his/her day to day schedule and share a proposed timeline to cope up with the studies.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key12:
Make a list of what he/she needs to do day-wise for a month
  - Week 1 : Dry run needs to be done till the topic that student is doing under the guidance of the respective mentor, and then T&P will interview them and then work on feedback.
  - Week 2: Each student needs to plan 3 classes till the topic with proper
documentation which they need to share before the class and T&P will interview
them, then work on feedback.
  - Week 3: Sprint and Projects decided by academic associates.
  - Week 4: For checking their improvement we will give a new topic to complete
within the timeline.
  - The academic associates will take the final interview.
Set up a personal hackathon often in this period, if needed
Academic_Probation_Policy_key13: SOP needs to be followed during Academic Probation
Academic_Probation_Policy_key15: Weekly feedback on progression to be given to the student by an Academic Associate or T&P and same to be communicated to the Academic lead/Program Manager (if student performance improved no need to follow next step)
Academic_Probation_Policy_key17: In case if still there is no performance improvement after a month of feedback he/she should be placed under probation after discussing with the Academic lead/Program Manager
Academic_Probation_Policy_key18:
Join discussion with the Student, Academic Associate, and Academic
lead/Program Manager on feedback and scope of the improvement plan
Academic_Probation_Policy_key19: Academic Associate should send a formal notice to the student over the email.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key20:
Campus team to assign an advisor/mentee to the student who will mentor
personally for a month
Academic_Probation_Policy_key21: Student to prepare a study planner and share the details with the team (tracker to be shared by the team)
Academic_Probation_Policy_key22:
Student to cut down from all the extracurricular activities in which he/she is
enrolled
Academic_Probation_Policy_key23:
The student will be free to indulge in a personal hackathon, unlimited until the
probation period continue
Academic_Probation_Policy_key24:
Academic associate to closely monitor the student for a month and help him/her
with timely feedback and guidance
Academic_Probation_Policy_key26: After completion of 30 days in probation Academic Associate reviews the performance and shares the final report with the team.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key27:
If there is improvement in the student’s progress, then the probationary period
will be discontinued.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key28: If there is no satisfactory progress, as decided by the Academic Associate, step 4 needs to be followed.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key30: A joint discussion with the student, student Parents/Guardian, Academic Associate, Academic lead, Program Manager, and Program Lead
Academic_Probation_Policy_key31:
Team to discuss with the student and his/her parents/guardian if he/she is willing to give a last try
  - If the student is willing to try, the team has to give a grace period of 15
days to work with the student and help him/her improve academically
  -  If the student is not willing to give it a try, share the final termination notice with the student, parents/guardian, and partners
Academic_Probation_Policy_key33: If there is improvement in the student’s progress, then the probationary period will be discontinued.
Academic_Probation_Policy_key34: If there is no satisfactory progress, as decided by the Academic Associate, share the final termination notice with the student, parents/guardian, and partners
